channel.title: Listen to The Lancet Oncology
channel.description: The Lancet Oncology is a monthly journal, renowned for the publication of high-quality peer reviewed research, reviews and analysis in cancer from around the world. In the monthly podcasts, editors of the journal discuss highlights of the current issue.
channel.itunes:author: The Lancet Oncology
channel.itunes:subtitle: Monthly discussion on the latest articles, reviews and comments published by The Lancet Oncology.
channel.itunes:summary: The Lancet Oncology is a monthly journal, renowned for the publication of high-quality peer reviewed research, reviews and analysis in cancer from around the world. In the monthly podcasts, editors of the journal discuss highlights of the current issue.
channel.itunes:keywords: cancer, oncology, tumour, chemotherapy, radiotherapy, surgery, research, trial, study, drug, metastatic, palliative

item.title: Future cancer research priorities in the USA: The Lancet Oncology Commission: October 31, 2017
item.description: Commission co-chairs Chi Van Dang and Elizabeth M. Jaffee discuss a new Lancet Oncology Commission on cancer treatment and care in the USA.
item.itunes:author: The Lancet
item.itunes:subtitle: Commission co-chairs Chi Van Dang and Elizabeth M. Jaffee discuss a new Lancet Oncology Commission on cancer treatment and care in the USA.

item.title: Cancer in Peru: The Lancet Oncology
item.description: Ben Anderson talks about cancer care and cancer trends in Peru.
item.itunes:author: The Lancet
item.itunes:subtitle: Ben Anderson talks about cancer care and cancer trends in Peru.

item.title: Indel derived tumour-specific neoantigens: The Lancet Oncology: Aug 2017
item.description: Samra Turajlic discusses the contribution of small insertions and deletions to tumour-specific antigen analyses.
item.itunes:author: The Lancet
item.itunes:subtitle: Samra Turajlic discusses the contribution of small insertions and deletions to tumour-specific antigen analyses.
item.itunes:keywords: neoantigen, mutations, insertions, deletions, indels, immunogenicity, check-point inhibitors, immunotherapy, renal cell cancer, melanoma
